DataElement.preferredName: Exclusion Criteria Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Plan Study Activity Repeat Frequency Ratio ISO21090.RTO.INT.NONNEG,PQ.TIME.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An activity that is intended to occur at some point in the context of a particular study that represents a characteristic or requirement intended to be applied to a potential study subject to determine whether they may not participate in a study. NOTE(S): This allows questions defined as agnostic criteria in defined eligibility criterion (that is, they could be used either as inclusion or exclusion criteria) to be referenced in specific study protocols and allows the inclusion/exclusion distinction to be determined for that study specifically. A ratio representing the number of occurrences of a planned activity within a given time period. EXAMPLE(S): Once per 12 hours, 2 times per day.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Exclusion Criteria Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Plan Study Activity Repeat Frequency Ratio
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.:To devise, contrive, or form in design.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions._Make or do or perform again.:The number of occurrences of something within a given time period.:Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.

Concepts.definition: Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.
To devise, contrive, or form in design.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Quantity quotient of a numerator of type INT.NONNEG divided by a denominator of type PQ.TIME.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
